translated: The Mansion on the Crest of the Eastern Mountain
The Story of the Male Spirit
The Great Charioteers
The First Mansion of the Elephant
Having mounted the elephant with the beautiful shoulders,
the tamed, powerful, and very swift one from the Akācī region;
Having mounted the well-trained supreme elephant,

original: Idhāgamā vehāyasaṁ antalikkhe.🔽Nāgassa dantesu duvesu nimmitā,🔽Acchodakā paduminiyo suphullā;
analyzed: idha āgamā vehāyasam antalikkhe  nāgassa dantesu duvesu nimmitā  accha udakā paduminiyaḥ su phullā
translated: you came here through the sky in the firmament.🔽Two lotus ponds with clear water and fully blossomed lotuses are created at the tips of the elephant’s tusks.
Musical instruments play among the lotuses,
and these delightful ones dance.
You have attained the divine power of the gods, you are greatly powerful.
What merit did you make as a human being?
By what are you so radiant,

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and your beauty shines in all directions?”
That god, being pleased,
was asked by Moggallāna.
When asked about the question,
he explained the fruit of that deed.
“I offered eight jasmine flowers
to the great sage Kassapa.🔽I scattered them on the stūpa
with my own hands, full of faith.
By that, I have such beauty,

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca me sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and my beauty shines in all directions.”
The first on the nāga-vimāna is the tenth.
